intro: Modecca senensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. Modecca senensis thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its beauty and ease of care in indoor environments.
